snippet: One of the main problems facing Major League Baseball and its next commissioner, Rob Manfred, is that attention spans are getting shorter while games are getting longer.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column holds that fundamental problem confronting incoming Major League Baseball commissioner Rob Manfred is that attention spans are getting shorter while games are getting longer; recommends several strategies for engaging younger fans, including brisker games and a focus on youth leagues.
lead_paragraph: One of the main problems facing Major League Baseball and its next commissioner, Rob Manfred, is that attention spans are getting shorter while games are getting longer.

headline.seo: Rob Manfred and M.L.B. Must Address Baseball Games’ Long Length
headline.main: In Push to Shorten Games, There’s No Time to Waste
headline.print_headline: In Push to Shorten Games, There’s No Time to Waste
